challenges.title: Introduction to the CSS Grid Challenges
description:
CSS grid is a revolutionary two-dimentional layout module that allows for easy implementation of complex and responsive user interfaces. It works by creating a spreadsheet-like grid on which elements could be placed effortlessly by specifying the desired column and row numbers.

Due to its popularity, CSS Grid is supported by most of the modern browsers today and it is gaining support among browsers quickly. This section covers how to use CSS grid and its related properties.

challenges.title: Create a Simple Grid Using the Display and Grid-template-columns Properties
description: Turning any element and its children into a CSS grid is as easy as setting up the display and grid-template-columns of the parent element similar to the example below:
Note that the number of units in the grid-template-columns property indicates the number of columns in the grid, and the value of each unit indicates the width of each column.
Turn the div with wrapper class to a grid with three rows. The width of each row should be 50px.

tests: assert(code.match(/.wrapper\s*?{[\s\S]*display\s*?:\s*?grid\s*?;[\s\S]*}/gi), 'message: wrapper class should have a display property with a value of grid.');

assert(code.match(/.wrapper\s*?{[\s\S]*grid-template-columns\s*?:\s*?50px\s*?50px\s*?50px\s*?;[\s\S]*}/gi), 'message: wrapper class should have a grid-template-columns property with three units of 50px.');
